greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients of certain polynomials used with prime numbers as variables in the computation of the array A103728.
comment: The g.f. for the sequence {b(N,p)}, with b(N,p) the number of cyclically inequivalent two-color, N bead necklaces with p beads of one color and N-p beads of the other color is, for prime numbers p, G(p(n),x):=P(p(n)-1,x)/((1-x)^(p(n)-1)*(1-x^p(n))), with the numerator polynomial P(p(n)-1,x):= sum(r(n,k)*x^k,k=0..p(n)-1) and the row polynomials of this triangle r(n,k):=sum(a(k,m)*p(n)^m,m=0..k). p(n)=A000040(n) (prime numbers).
Row sums (signed) give A000142(k)=k!. Row sums (unsigned) coincide with A007680(k)=(2*k+1)*k!, k>=0.
The (unsigned) column sequences are, for m=0..10: A000774, A081052, A103719-A103727.
link: W. Lang, Initial section of triangular array.
formula: Let B = (n+1)-st row of Stirling cycle numbers (unsigned, A008275); say a,b,c,d,.... Then n-th row of present triangle = ((a+b), (b+c), (c+d), ..., (d)). E.g., 4th row of the Stirling cycle numbers = (6, 11, 6, 1). Then third row of A103718 = ((6+11), (11+6), (6+1), (1)) = (17, 17, 7, 1). - _Gary W. Adamson_, May 07 2006
program: {for(k=0, 9, for(m=0, k, print1(a(k, m),", ");); print(););} \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 11 2017
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 24 2005
